name: php-assistant
description: A cross-platform desktop app for testing PHP snippets

scripts.dist:linux: build --linux deb rpm freebsd pacman tar.xz --ia32 --x64
scripts.publish:linux: build --linux deb rpm freebsd pacman tar.xz --publish onTagOrDraft
scripts.publish:win: npm run publish:win32 && npm run publish:win64

releases.name: Release 0.0.11
releases.body:
**Changelog**
- Presentation mode is done (#23)
- Fixing OSX window drag bug (#111)
- Some minor UI improvements

releases.name: Release 0.0.10
releases.body: Some bugfixes and setting deploy back to GitHub releases.

releases.name: Release 0.0.7
releases.body:
0.0.7 and any further release will be available at BinTray repositories.

Head for it: [Windows](https://bintray.com/rafajaques/windows), [Mac OSX](https://bintray.com/rafajaques/mac-osx) and [Debian/Ubuntu/Mint](https://bintray.com/rafajaques/deb).

If you're running any other OS, you may download the source code and have it running with `npm install && npm start` (install NodeJS first).

RPM packages will be released soon.

releases.name: Release 0.0.6
releases.body: A lot of bugfixes and stability upgrade.

releases.name: Release 0.0.5
releases.body:
I'm very proud to announce version 0.0.5.
Now featuring multiple PHP binaries, presentation mode and two new languages (German and Danish)!
I would like to thank everyone that is helping me out in that project! :)

releases.name: Almost stable
releases.body:
In this version, almost everything is working.
A few minor bugs that are going be fixed soon.
Many thanks to everybody helping as a bug catcher!

Download links below!

releases.name: Things are starting to work...
releases.body:
It looks like things are starting to work. I just added "tray mode" and it seems to be working quite well.
To celebrate that, I'm releasing binaries in ZIP, not in 7z (less compression).
Every feedback is appreciated!

releases.name: Second pre-release
releases.body:
Two major fixes!
1. You may use paths with whitespaces.
2. If it's not possible to find PHP binary, the app should ask for its path.

These changes are not critical in OSX, so you may use v0.0.1.

releases.name: First pre-release
releases.body:
This is the first version I can call "usable". However, it will only work with PHP on specific paths.

var unix_paths = [
  "/usr/bin/php",
  "/usr/sbin/php",
  "/etc/php",
  "/usr/lib/php",
  "/usr/share/php"
]

var win_paths = [
  "C:\php\php.exe",
  "C:\xampp\php\php.exe"
]
